meanings.definition: To restore to a former better state (verb)
meanings.sent1: The family decided to renovate their old house to make it beautiful again.
meanings.sent2: They hired a team of experts to renovate the historic building downtown.
meanings.sent3: After many years, the old carwash was finally renovated and now looks brand new.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a renovated painting, bright and full of life.
meanings.sent5: The garden was renovated with colorful flowers, transforming it into a vibrant paradise.

meanings.definition: To make new or as if new again (verb)
meanings.sent1: The company decided to renovate their logo to attract younger customers.
meanings.sent2: She wanted to renovate her wardrobe by adding trendy pieces.
meanings.sent3: The magician's hat seemed to renovate itself with every trick he performed.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a fresh breeze, renovating her spirit and giving her hope.
meanings.sent5: The sunrise seemed to renovate the sky, painting it with warm colors.
